001package io.jstach.ezkv.kvs;
002
003import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;
004import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
005import java.io.IOException;
006import java.io.InputStream;
007import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
008import java.net.URI;
009import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
010import java.util.Optional;
011import java.util.Properties;
012import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
013
014import org.jspecify.annotations.Nullable;
015
016import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesMedia.Parser;
017import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesMediaFinder;
018
019/**
020 * Represents a media type for parsing and formatting key-value pairs. A
021 * {@code KeyValuesMedia} provides parsing and formatting capabilities for specific media
022 * types and can be searched based on file extensions or media types.
023 *
024 * <p>
025 * Out-of-the-box implementations include properties and URL-encoded formats. <strong>The
026 * properties and URL encoded formats do maintain order of the key values parsed and do
027 * allow duplicate keys (unlike regular java.util {@link Properties})! </strong>
028 * <p>
029 * Example usage for parsing an {@code InputStream}:
030 * {@snippet :
031 * KeyValuesMedia propertiesMedia = KeyValuesMedia.ofProperties();
032 * KeyValues parsedKeyValues = propertiesMedia.parser().parse(resource, inputStream);
033 * }
034 * For a formal specification of media types see:
035 * <a href="https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6838"> Media Type Specifications and
036 * Registration Procedures RFC 6838 </a>
037 * <p>
038 * All KeyValuesMedia implement {@link KeyValuesMediaFinder} and thus each media can be
039 * queried if it is a match of file extension of media type. When a
040 * {@link KeyValuesSystem} is fully loaded it will have a list of all found
041 * {@link KeyValuesMedia} and create a composite {@link KeyValuesMediaFinder}.
042 *
043 * @see KeyValues
044 * @see Parser
045 * @see Formatter
046 * @see #ofProperties()
047 * @see #ofUrlEncoded()
048 * @see KeyValuesSystem#mediaFinder()
049 * @see KeyValuesResource#mediaType()
050 * @see KeyValuesResource#KEY_MEDIA_TYPE
051 */
052public interface KeyValuesMedia extends KeyValuesMediaFinder {
053
054        /**
055         * Media Type for {@link Properties}.
056         */
057        public static String MEDIA_TYPE_PROPERTIES = "text/x-java-properties";
058
059        /**
060         * Media Type for URL encoded pairs which is almost entirely compatible with URI
061         * percent encoding.
062         */
063        public static String MEDIA_TYPE_URLENCODED = "application/x-www-form-urlencoded";
064
065        /**
066         * File extension for {@link Properties} files.
067         */
068        public static String FILE_EXT_PROPERTIES = "properties";
069
070        /**
071         * Returns the media type as a string and should ideally be in
072         * <a href="https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6838">rfc6838 format</a>, is
073         * required and should be unique from other {@link KeyValuesMedia} unlike
074         * {@link #getFileExt()}. For implementers if there is not a registered media type a
075         * recommendation is to use <code>application/x-ext</code> where "ext" would be
076         * replaced with the file extension or some name.
077         * @return the media type
078         */
079        public String getMediaType();
080
081        /**
082         * Returns the file extension associated with the media type, if any. The first period
083         * "<code>.</code>" should not be included. For example <code>.tar.gz</code> should be
084         * <code>tar.gz</code>.
085         * @return the file extension or {@code null} if not applicable
086         */
087        public @Nullable String getFileExt();
088
089        /**
090         * Returns a {@link Parser} for parsing key-value pairs from an input stream.
091         * @return the parser
092         */
093        public Parser parser();
094
095        /**
096         * Returns a parser that maybe customized by parameters. By default {@link #parser()}
097         * is called.
098         * @param parameters parameters that can come from
099         * {@link KeyValuesResource#parameters()}.
100         * @return parser
101         */
102        default Parser parser(Variables parameters) {
103                return parser();
104        }
105
106        /**
107         * Returns a {@link Formatter} for formatting key-value pairs to an appendable target.
108         * By default, this method throws {@link UnsupportedOperationException} if formatting
109         * is not supported.
110         * @return the formatter
111         * @throws UnsupportedOperationException if formatting is not supported
112         */
113        default Formatter formatter() throws UnsupportedOperationException {
114                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
115        }
116
117        /**
118         * Returns a {@code KeyValuesMedia} instance for the {@link Properties} format however
119         * unlike normal {@link Properties} order of the properties key values is maintained
120         * based on the order parsed and <strong>duplicate key names are allowed</strong>.
121         * @return a properties format media type
122         */
123        public static KeyValuesMedia ofProperties() {
124                return DefaultKeyValuesMedia.PROPERTIES;
125        }
126
127        /**
128         * Returns a {@code KeyValuesMedia} instance for the URL-encoded format.
129         * @return a URL-encoded format media type
130         */
131        public static KeyValuesMedia ofUrlEncoded() {
132                return DefaultKeyValuesMedia.URLENCODED;
133        }
134
135        @Override
136        default Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByExt(String ext) {
137                if (ext.equalsIgnoreCase(getFileExt())) {
138                        return Optional.of(this);
139                }
140                return Optional.empty();
141        }
142
143        @Override
144        default Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByMediaType(String mediaType) {
145                if (getMediaType().equalsIgnoreCase(mediaType)) {
146                        return Optional.of(this);
147                }
148                return Optional.empty();
149        }
150
151        @Override
152        default Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByUri(URI uri) {
153                if (hasFileExt(uri)) {
154                        return Optional.of(this);
155                }
156                return Optional.empty();
157        }
158
159        /**
160         * Reads an {@link InputStream} and converts it to a UTF-8 encoded string.
161         * @param inputStream the input stream to read which will not be closed by this call.
162         * @return the string representation of the input stream
163         * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs
164         */
165        public static String inputStreamToString(InputStream inputStream) throws IOException {
166                try (ByteArrayOutputStream result = new ByteArrayOutputStream()) {
167                        inputStream.transferTo(result);
168                        return result.toString(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
169                }
170
171        }
172
173        /**
174         * A parser for reading key-value pairs from an input source.
175         */
176        public interface Parser {
177
178                /**
179                 * Parses key-value pairs from an input stream and applies them to a consumer.
180                 * @param input the input stream to read from
181                 * @param consumer the consumer to apply the parsed key-value pairs
182                 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during parsing
183                 */
184                void parse(InputStream input, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) throws IOException;
185
186                /**
187                 * Parses key-value pairs from an input stream and associates them with a given
188                 * resource.
189                 * @param source the resource from which the key-values are sourced
190                 * @param is the input stream to read from
191                 * @return a {@code KeyValues} instance containing the parsed key-value pairs
192                 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during parsing
193                 */
194                default KeyValues parse(KeyValuesResource source, InputStream is) throws IOException {
195                        var b = KeyValues.builder(source);
196                        parse(is, b::add);
197                        return b.build();
198                }
199
200                /**
201                 * Parses key-value pairs from a string and applies them to a consumer.
202                 * @param input the string to parse
203                 * @param consumer the consumer to apply the parsed key-value pairs
204                 */
205                default void parse(String input, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
206                        try {
207                                parse(stringToInputStream(input), consumer);
208                        }
209                        catch (IOException e) {
210                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
211                        }
212                }
213
214                /**
215                 * Parses key-value pairs from a string and returns a {@code KeyValues} instance.
216                 * @param input the string to parse
217                 * @return a {@code KeyValues} instance containing the parsed key-value pairs
218                 */
219                default KeyValues parse(String input) {
220                        var b = KeyValues.builder();
221                        parse(input, b::add);
222                        return b.build();
223                }
224
225                private static InputStream stringToInputStream(String s) {
226                        return new ByteArrayInputStream(s.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
227                }
228
229        }
230
231        /**
232         * A formatter for writing key-value pairs to an output.
233         */
234        public interface Formatter {
235
236                /**
237                 * Formats key-value pairs into the provided {@link Appendable}.
238                 * @param appendable the appendable to write to
239                 * @param kvs the key-value pairs to format
240                 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during formatting
241                 */
242                public void format(Appendable appendable, KeyValues kvs) throws IOException;
243
244                /**
245                 * Formats key-value pairs into a {@link StringBuilder}.
246                 * @param stringBuilder the string builder to write to
247                 * @param kvs the key-value pairs to format
248                 */
249                default void format(StringBuilder stringBuilder, KeyValues kvs) {
250                        try {
251                                format((Appendable) stringBuilder, kvs);
252                        }
253                        catch (IOException e) {
254                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
255                        }
256                }
257
258                /**
259                 * Formats key-value pairs and returns them as a string.
260                 * @param kvs the key-value pairs to format
261                 * @return the formatted key-value pairs as a string
262                 */
263                default String format(KeyValues kvs) {
264                        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
265                        format(sb, kvs);
266                        return sb.toString();
267                }
268
269        }
270
271        /**
272         * Checks if a given filename has the file extension associated with this media type.
273         * @param filename the filename to check
274         * @return {@code true} if the filename ends with the media type's file extension,
275         * otherwise {@code false}
276         */
277        default boolean hasFileExt(String filename) {
278                String ext = getFileExt();
279                if (ext == null) {
280                        return false;
281                }
282                return filename.endsWith("." + ext);
283        }
284
285        /**
286         * Checks if the URI's path has the file extension associated with this media type.
287         * @param uri the URI to check
288         * @return {@code true} if the URI's path ends with the media type's file extension,
289         * otherwise {@code false}
290         */
291        default boolean hasFileExt(URI uri) {
292                String p = uri.getPath();
293                if (p == null)
294                        return false;
295                return hasFileExt(p);
296        }
297
298        // default void prettyPrint(StringBuilder sb) {
299        // sb.append(toString()).append("(").append(getMediaType()).append(", ");
300        // var fe = getFileExt();
301        // if (fe != null) {
302        // sb.append(fe);
303        // }
304        // sb.append(")");
305        // }
306
307}
308
309class SafeParser implements KeyValuesMedia.Parser {
310
311        private final KeyValuesMedia.Parser delegate;
312
313        private final String mediaType;
314
315        @Override
316        public void parse(InputStream input, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) throws IOException {
317                try {
318                        delegate.parse(input, consumer);
319                }
320                catch (KeyValuesException e) {
321                        throw e;
322                }
323                catch (RuntimeException e) {
324                        String message = "Parsing failed. mediaType=" + mediaType + e.toString();
325                        throw new KeyValuesMediaException(message, e, mediaType);
326                }
327
328        }
329
330        @Override
331        public KeyValues parse(KeyValuesResource source, InputStream is) throws IOException {
332                try {
333                        return delegate.parse(source, is);
334                }
335                catch (KeyValuesException e) {
336                        throw e;
337                }
338                catch (RuntimeException e) {
339                        String message = "Parsing failed for mediaType='" + mediaType + "'. " + e.getMessage();
340                        throw new KeyValuesMediaException(message, e, mediaType);
341                }
342        }
343
344        @Override
345        public void parse(String input, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
346                try {
347                        delegate.parse(input, consumer);
348                }
349                catch (KeyValuesException e) {
350                        throw e;
351                }
352                catch (RuntimeException e) {
353                        String message = "Parsing failed. mediaType=" + mediaType + e.toString();
354                        throw new KeyValuesMediaException(message, e, mediaType);
355                }
356        }
357
358        @Override
359        public KeyValues parse(String input) {
360                return delegate.parse(input);
361        }
362
363        public SafeParser(Parser delegate, String mediaType) {
364                super();
365                this.delegate = delegate;
366                this.mediaType = mediaType;
367        }
368
369}
